title: Revolutions of 1989
summary: These where a series of revolutions that took place in Eastern Europe that ended the Soviet Union's control over the region. The revolutions began in Poland and spread to Hungary, East Germany, Bulgaria, Czechoslovakia, and Romania. With the %{fall of the Berlin Wall#Fall of the Berlin Wall} in 1989, the Soviet Union's control over Eastern Europe was effectively ended. With the Romanian Revolution ending violently compared to the &{Velvet Revolution} in Czechoslovakia which ended peacefully.
